New Records: Virat Kohli scored 85 runs, his highest score in the match
KL Rahul scored 97 runs, his highest score in the match
Ravindra Jadeja took 3 wickets for 28 runs
Kuldeep Yadav took 2 wickets for 42 runs
Key Match Events: India lost three quick wickets for just two runs
Mitchell Marsh dropped Virat Kohli on 12 which proved costly
Kohli and Rahul formed a 165-run partnership for the fourth wicket
Pre-Game Insights: Australia won the toss but struggled with batting, especially after a poor start
India's spinners, led by Ravindra Jadeja and Kuldeep Yadav, dominated the Australian innings
Post-Match Reflections: Virat Kohli and KL Rahul were praised for their performances
Pat Cummins expressed frustration at the dropped catch of Kohli and the overall batting performance
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was low-scoring with no Australian batsman reaching 50
The pitch was spin-friendly, aiding India's strategy
India's poor start with three quick losses for minimal runs was a key factor
